site_name: Phase 3.2 Of The Acton Gardens Master Plan;

protected_spaces_details.description: Provision for children and young people

description: Removal of the Bollo Brook Youth Centre and leisure facilities in South Park and the construction of a part six to eight storey building containing 99 flats (31 one-bedroom, 41 two-bedroom, 25 three-bedroom, two four-bedroom units) and seventeen three to four storey townhouses (all four-bedroom); 21 off-street parking spaces; alterations to existing  highway layout (including alterations to the layout of parking spaces in Osborne Road) and construction of a new north-south street between Osborne Road and Bollo Bridge Road; refuse and cycle stores and landscaping (Departure Application).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:   Drawings: (MLA/349/P/) - 000 P1, 001 P1, 003 P1 A, 100 P1 A, 101 P1 A, 102 P1 A, 103 P1 A, 104 P1 A, 105 P1 A, 106 P1 A, 107 P1 A, 120 P1 A, 121 P1 A, 122 P1 A, 123 P1 A, 124 P1 A, 125 P1 A, 126 P1 A, 127 P1 A, 128 P1 A, 300 P1 , 301 P1, 302 P1, 303 P1, 320 P1, 321 P1 A, 322 P1 A, 323 P1, Affordable Rent Flat - Design and Access Statement (Maccreanor Lavington); Heritage Statement (ref: 1806.03C, Terence O'Rourke); Environmental Noise and Vibration Assessment (ref: DLW/6702/A, Acoustical Investigation & Research Organisation Ltd); Phase 1 Geotechnical and Geo-environmental Summary Desk Study Report (ref: 60216282 Issue 2, AECOM); Planning Supporting Statement (ref: 180603C, Terence O'Rourke); Statement of Community Involvement (Acton Gardens LLP); Affordable Housing Statement, Estate Management Strategy (London & Quandrant Housing Trust); Updated Phasing Strategy and drawing ref: 020; Transport Statement (ref: PH/cs/ITB9027-003A R, i-Transport LLP); (draft) Residential Travel Plan (ref: PH/hm/ITB9027-004A R, i-Transport Ltd); Phase 1 Habitat Survey (Terence O'Rourke); Arboricultural Survey (ref: 0813-1242 Final, Ruskins); Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment (ref: J1856 Issue 04, Mendick Waring Ltd); Daylight and Sunlight Performance Analysis (Rev 5, AECOM); Energy Strategy (ref: J1856 Issue 06, Mendick Waring Ltd); Foul and Surface Water Drainage Scheme (ref: A1829, CTP); Water Statement (ref: J1856 Issue 03, Mendick Waring Ltd); Response to Ealing Council Nov-13 ref: J1856 Issue 01 (06/11/2013) prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd; Stage 1 Road Safety Audit (04/11/2013) and addendum ref: MB/2013/9802/RSA1 (13/11/2013), prepared by GM Traffic Consultants Ltd; Clarification in response to Highway officer's comments ref: ITL9027 (08/11/2013) and 'Designer's response to Stage 1 Road Safety Audit for Phases 3.1 and 3.2' ref: PH/RN/ITL9027-005 TN and drawing ITB9027-SK-007, prepared by i-Transport.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | No development shall commence in relation to the approved development until the detailed design of the temporary public open space on the former Caine House site, which shall have a minimum area of 1,670sq.m, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submission shall include details of the following matters:   A) soft landscaping: including trees, grass and turf areas, shrub and herbaceous areas;  B) hard landscaping: including ground surfaces, kerbs, edges, paving, seating and other public realm furniture, steps, and any synthetic surfaces;  C) enclosures and boundary treatments, including types, dimensions and finishes of walls, fences, screen walls, barriers, bollards, rails, retaining walls and hedges;  D) play equipment, including safety surfacing;  E) management and maintenance strategy; and  F) work phasing plan.   The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision.  All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions.  Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted, are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.  G) The approved scheme shall be completed / planted during the first planting season following the demolition of Caine House, or in accordance with the approved work phasing plan.   H) No residential units within the approved development shall be occupied until the temporary public open space is ready for use.   I) The temporary open space shall be maintained in accordance with the approved management and maintenance strategy approved under sub-point (E) until such time that the site is required for development purposes in accordance with the approved phasing strategy.   Reason: The provision of the temporary public open space and associated children's play space is required in order to provide mitigation for the temporary loss of public open space within the site as a result of the proposals to develop on an existing area of designated public open space and in accordance with the requirements set out at paragraph 74 of the NPPF and policies 2.18, 3.6 and 7.18 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(e), 1.1(i), 1.2(d) and 2.1(c) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy LV2.18 and 7D of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | No development shall commence in relation to the approved development until a separate planning application for the temporary replacement youth centre, which shall have a minimum gross internal area of at least the equivalent gross internal area of the existing Bollo Brook Youth Centre, is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   The temporary youth centre shall be completed and ready for use prior to the demolition of the existing Bollo Brook Youth Centre and maintained until alternative provision is provided within Phase 6 of the Acton Gardens LLP development or as otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure continuity of the provision of essential community facilities within the South Acton Estate in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.16 and 7.1 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(e), 1.1(h) and 6.2 of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to the commencement of development, a site construction logistics plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submission shall include details of the following matters:   A)	The number of on-site construction workers and details of the transport options and parking facilities for them; B)	anticipated route, anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site per day; C)	delivery times and booking system (which is to be staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school-run peak periods); D)	route and location of site access for construction traffic and associated signage; E)	management of consolidated or re-timed trips; F)	Details of noise/vibration and dust mitigation measures and monitoring arrangements for noise, vibration and dust by suitably qualified noise and air quality specialists.  Noise/vibration and dust mitigation measures must accord with the Mayor's 'Best Practice Guidance: The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition ' (2006) and BS 5228 Parts 1 & 2 (2009); G)	details of site security and the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing where appropriate; H)	secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities; I)	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how construction vehicles would access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear and including details of any temporary vehicle access points; J)	details as to the location(s) for storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices; K)	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from members of the public; L)	measures to consult cyclists, disabled people and the local schools and nursery with regard  to delivery times and necessary diversions; M)	details of all pedestrian and cyclist diversions; N)	a commitment to be part of Considerate Constructors Scheme; and O)	confirmation of use of TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar  Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name, phone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site construction compound and development site.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.  Any areas to be used for the storage of building materials or other site activities outside of the relevant phase of the development shall be returned to their original condition immediately following the practical completion of the development.  Reason:  To ensure the provision of appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of the pupils of the local schools and nursery, local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety; and also to ensure that protected species are appropriately safeguarded,  in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.18, 6.3, 7.14, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(e), 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Planning permission is hereby granted for the removal of trees and other vegetation as detailed on drawing TSP1 Rev1, MLA/349/P/600/P1 and Arboricultural Report and Tree Condition Survey ref: 0813-1242 Final (prepared by Ruskins).  Any vegetation clearance, including tree removal, should be conducted outside of the bird nesting season which is considered to run from March to September. Where this is not possible a suitably qualified ecologist will be required to check potential nesting habitat immediately prior to clearance. Where nesting birds are encountered clearance must be postponed until chicks have fledged.  Reason: To ensure that nesting birds are appropriately safeguarded, in accordance with the relevant National legislation, including The Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended) and The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2010; the NPPF, and policies 5.3 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.4 of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | A) No development other than demolition to existing ground level shall take place until the applicant (or their heirs and successors in title) has secured the implementation of a programme of Archaeological Evaluation in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority;  B) If heritage assets are found under part (A), then no development shall commence (except for demolition to ground level) until the applicant has secured a programme of Archaeological Investigation in accordance with the Written Scheme of Investigation and no further demolition shall take place except in accordance with the approved Written Scheme of Investigation. C) No part of the development shall be occupied until the site investigation and post investigation assessment has been completed in accordance with the programme set out in the Written Scheme of Investigation approved under sub-point (B), and the provision for analysis, publication and dissemination of the results and archive deposition has been secured.  Reason: Heritage assets of archaeological interest may survive on the site and the provision of appropriate archaeological investigation, including the publication of results is required in accordance with Section 12 of the NPPF and policy 7.8 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7C of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | Prior to the commencement of development (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works), details in line with the criteria specified in Ealing's Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 (Noise and Vibration) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category and the BS4142 rating noise. The details shall also include the building envelope noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and screening for external amenity areas where necessary.    The details shall also include the sound mitigation measures provided between the ceiling and floor of the residential units.  The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units within the development.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 7A and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | Within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works, details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval that demonstrates that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed plant and machinery at the development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 7A and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | Within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works, a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the Bollo Bridge Road fatade shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The air supply shall be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied.  Reason: The Air Quality Stage 4 Review and Assessment for the London Borough of Ealing has highlighted that this area currently experiences or is likely to experience exceedences of Government set air quality standards and air quality mitigation is required. It is necessary that future occupiers are not exposed to poor air quality that could have a negative impact on health and as such, mitigation would be necessary in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(e) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7A and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of development (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works) a soil contamination investigation and risk assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This contamination investigation and risk assessment should include details of the following matters:   A.	a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;  B.	an assessment of the potential risks to:- human health, property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes, adjoining land, groundwaters and surface waters, ecological systems (as relevant); C.	A detailed soil contamination remediation scheme;   The soil contamination investigation should be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11'.   The soil contamination remediation scheme must include details of all works to be undertaken, proposed contamination remediation objectives and contamination remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  The approved soil contamination remediation scheme should be carried out in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.   Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents of the new development in accordance policy 1.1(e) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2011; policies LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and  DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11'. | Following completion of the approved soil contamination remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.   The verification report submitted shall be prepared in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.  Reason: To protect the health and the living conditions of residents, in accordance policy 1.1(e) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2011; policy LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), and  DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11'. | The scheme for surface water drainage and foul water drainage shall be provided in accordance with the recommendations contained within the approved Foul and Surface Drainage Statement (B), prepared by CTP, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Thames Water and the Environment Agency.  Reason:  To minimise the risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality, improve habitat and amenity and in the interests of the drainage network in accordance with policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy LV5.12 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Within 6 months of the commencent of the superstructure works, details of the siting, specification and external apperance of the gate restricting access to the off-street parking area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The gate shall be installed in accordance with the approved details prior to the occupation of any of the dwellings the off-street parking area serves.   Reason:  To ensure that the adequate security features are incorporated into the development that are appropriate to the overall design of the buildings and are adequate to promote safety and security, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.6 and 7.13 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV7.3 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | The development shall achieve a Code of Sustainable Homes rating of no less than 'Level 4' (based on November 2010 Technical Guidance), in accordance with the approved Code for Sustainable Homes Pre Assessment Report (issue 04), prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd.  Within three months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or similar approved body) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and an Interim Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment and Interim Design Certificates shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  Within 6 months from the date of first occupation of the development, Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE (or similar approved body) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented.   Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable development in accordance with policies: 3.5, 5.1; 5.2; 5.3 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy LV3.5 and LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of the superstructure works, full details of the CHP system described in the approved Energy Strategy (prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd with ref: J1856, dated 11/09/2013) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include information to satisfy the following matters:  A.	the location of the CHP, its specification and operation / management strategy; B.	flue location, height, design and written confirmation that the proposal complies with the minimum requirements of HMIP Guidance on Discharge Stack Heights for Polluting Emissions (D1); C.	the method of how the CHP and other infrastructure shall be designed to allow for the future connection to the decentralised heating and cooling network; and D.	A statement as to the provision of NOx Emission Control for the CHP engine.   The CHP system shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the first dwelling within the development hereby approved.    Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy LV5.2 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | The details of the layout and array of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 42.5kWp of electricity as detailed within the approved Energy Strategy (prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd with ref: J1856, dated 11/09/2013), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the development.  The photovoltaic panels shall therefater be installed in accordance with the approved details and be operational prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.7, and 5.8 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy LV5.2 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until an Arboricultural Method Statement (AMS) for the protection of existing trees, shrubs and hedgerows has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the approved AMS has been implemented on site.  All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:  A.	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads. B.	A plan** detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal. C.	Soil assessments/survey D.	Timing and phasing of works E.	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications F.	Site specific construction specifications G.	Access arrangements and car parking H.	Level changes I.	Landscaping proposals J.	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.   K.	Soil remediation plans.  All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.  *Using the most recent revision the of the Standard ** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)  Reason: To secure the protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area; in accordance with policies 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and 1.1(i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until a suitable programme of monitoring all approved tree protection measures has been submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The monitoring programme shall include the following:  A.	Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development. B.	Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key responsibilities and contact details. C.	Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to Arboricultural matters. D.	A detailed timetable of events concerning the approved tree protection plans including; initial implementation of the protective measures, the final removal of the protective measures and any incursion/alterations to accommodate site specific construction/demolition procedures as approved in the Arboricultural Method Statement and the level of supervision required. E.	Procedures for dealing with variations or non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement. F.	Agreements of when site monitoring will take place with the local Tree Officer either by site meetings or by some other pre-arranged agreement.  G.	Post development assessment of the retained and planted trees and any necessary remedial action.  The programme of Arboricultural monitoring shall be taken in full compliance with the approved details.  No variation of the approved monitoring program shall take place without the prior written agreement of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of visual amenity for the area; in accordance with policies 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and 1.1(i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to the commencement of the superstructure works the details of the proposed new tree planting, including street tree planting, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submission shall include details of the following matters:   A.	Full planting specification - Tree size, species and the numbers of trees.  B.	Positions of all proposed species. C.	Comprehensive details of ground preparation and pit details. D.	Staking/tying method(s). E.	5 year post planting maintenance schedule with an inspection schedule.  The location and number of new tree plantings (but not necessarily the tree species) shall accord, where feasible following further detailed investigative surveys, with the indicative tree planting locations illustrated on approved drawing MLA/349/P/600 and Section 4.5 of the Design and Access Statement.  All tree-planting shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the earliest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) to the completion of the approved development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision.  All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions.  Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.  Reason:  To secure the appropriate provision of the proposed replacement tree planting and street-tree planting and to ensure that the life of the trees would not be unduly constrained in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Ealing Local Variation to policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the soft and hard landscaping details illustrated on approved drawing MLA/349/P/600; Sections 4, 5.4 and 5.9 of the Design and Access Statement and the recommendations at Section 5 of the Extended Phase 1 Habitat Survey, further detailed landscaping proposals shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The landscaping details should include the following information:   A.	Full details of the children's play area, including safety surfacing and equipment; B.	Soft landscaping: including grass and turf areas, hedges, shrub and herbaceous areas, and tree strategy including species type and size at planting; C.	Hard landscaping: including ground surfaces, kerbs, e
site_number: South Acton Estate phase 3.2, South Park & Land North of
